relation: Renamed in 1.8 to commandEditor. Specifies whether the Command Editor shall be shown instead of the Command Line.
Renamed in 1.8 to showStackTrace. Specifies whether to show the stack trace for JavaScript errors inside the Console Panel
Removed in 1.10 in favor of the Start Button
Set to true, if Firefox addon-bar has been initially opened for the user (to see the status bar icon at least the first time)
Renamed to consoleFilterTypes in 1.8. Type of messages shown inside the Console Panel
Renamed to trackThrowCatch in 1.8. Specifies whether to track throw/catch blocks inside the Script Panel
Renamed to scriptsFilter in 1.8. Type filter used for the Script Location Menu
Removed in 1.7. Specifies whether eval() expressions shall be decompiled inside the Script Panel.
Renamed to breakOnErrors in 1.8. Toggles the Break On Errors feature
The Memory Profiler feature was removed for now in 1.10 for stability and usability reasons.
Renamed to netFilterCategories in 1.12. File type filter used inside the Net Panel's Request List
all, css, js, xhr, image, plugin, media, font
Firebug Menu->Options->Always Open in New Window
Command Line->Red button with up arrow at the right
Console panel Options Menu->Show Stack Trace With Errors
Removed in 1.12, because it's not needed anymore
Script panel Options Menu->Decompile for eval() source
HTML panel Options Menu->Show Basic Entities
Script panel Options Menu->Show chrome sources
Console panel options menu > Show External Errors
textBeforeTable: Main preferences 6 See also 5 Tracing options 4 Preferences from older versions 3 Preferences not set by default 2 Keyboard shortcut preferences 1 Main preferences Contents Firebug adds several configuration options to Firefox. Some of these options can be changed through the UI, others can be manipulated only via about:config. The following table is a list of all preferences Firebug is having (all preferences besides javascript.options.strict.debug are starting with "extensions.firebug.", but for space reasons this is left out). Revision as of 22:33, 8 June 2014 [[Category:Firebug]] +   +   [[FBTrace Preferences]] [[FBTrace Preferences]] == See also == == See also == Line 494: Line 440: |}
textAfterTable: showFirstRunPage Firebug 1.9 Specifies whether to show an info page with information about what has changed when Firebug is updated true, false true - useDefaultLocale Set to true, if Firebug should use default (en-US) locale instead of the current Firefox locale true, false false - activateSameOrigin Specifies whether to activate Firebug for all pages matching the same origin policy. If deactivated, Firebug will be activated for each URL path individually (disregarding parameters and anchors) Read more about Firebug Activation. true, false true Firebug Menu > Options > Activate Same Origin URLs toolbarCustomizationDone Set to true if the Start Button has been initially appended into Firefox toolbar true, false false - showBreakNotification If true, Firebug shows a notification message when break in debugger happens (break on debugger; keyword, break on an error, etc.) true, false true Script panel options menu > Show Break Notifications stringCropLength Firebug 1.9 Default length limit for cropped strings non-negative integer
